SENT.plain: Sixty-six cases of Burkitt's lymphoma were studied
Twenty-five of the cases had tumour involvement of the bowel
The commonest site of gastro-intestinal involvement was the stomach
No lesions were found in the oesophagus and rectum except in one case where the tumour was thought to have extended to the lower oesphagus from the cardia of the stomach
Attention is drawn to complications that may arise which require emergency measures and also to the infrequency of symptoms directly referable to bowel lesions
